00051 /**
00052  * Summarize and output basic statistics on the performance of a
00053  * particular summarization or detection method across a number of cel
00054  * files. All reports have statistics for raw probe intensity across a
00055  * chip. Detection based methods output the percentage above a certain
00056  * score. Summarization methods output the average and stdev for
00057  * summarized values, RLE (relative log expression), and MAD (median
00058  * absolute residual) when method provides residuals.
00059  * 
00060  */
00061 class QuantMethodRunReport : public QuantMethodReport {
00062 
00063 public :
00064 
00065   /** Constructor. */
00066   QuantMethodRunReport(const std::vector<std::string> &chipNames);
00067 
00068   /** Override the default file name **/
00069 //  void setFileName(const std::string &filename) {
00070 //      m_FileName = filename;
00071 //  }
00072 
00073   /** 
00074    * Get set up for a run of reporting probesets. 
00075    * @param qMethod - Quantification method to be used.
00076    * @param layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
00077    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00078    */
00079   bool prepare(QuantMethod &qMethod, const IntensityMart &iMart);
00080 
00081   /** 
00082    * After every probeset computation this function is called an is an opportunity
00083    * to query the quantification method for results, residuals, etc.
00084    * @param psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
00085    * @param qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
00086    * @param layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
00087    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00088    */  
00089   bool report(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, QuantMethod &qMethod,
00090               const IntensityMart &iMart, std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00091               PmAdjuster &pmAdjust);
00092 
00093   /** 
00094    * Finish outputting results and clean up.
00095    * @param qMethod - Quantification method that was used.
00096    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00097    */
00098   bool finish(QuantMethod &qMethod) {
00099       return finish();
00100   }
00101 
00102   /** 
00103    * Finish outputting results and clean up.
00104    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00105    */
00106   bool finish();
00107 
00108   /**
00109    * Register a Chip Summary interface instance to pull metrics from
00110    */
00111   void registerChipSummary(ChipSummary *summary);
00112 
00113   /**
00114    * Override base class to catch meta info and comments from engine
00115    */
00116   // this is sooo bougus
00117   // void out(const std::string &s, bool comment);
00118 
00119 private :
00120   /// File name for printing report.
00121   //std::string m_FileName;
00122   /// Name for each of our chips.
00123   std::vector<std::string> m_ChipNames;
00124   /// Various Chip Summary Data Sources
00125   std::vector<ChipSummary *> m_ChipSummaries;
00126   /// Keys in order for header. -- META INFO
00127   //std::vector<std::string> m_HeaderKeys;
00128   /// Values matching the above keys in same order as above. -- META INFO
00129   //std::vector<std::string> m_HeaderVals;
00130   /// Other descriptive string and comments to put in header. -- META INFO
00131   //std::vector<std::string> m_OtherLines;
00132 };
